questions.question: What is the yield percentage of the monocationic compound 1 synthesized from bis(allyl)calcium and bis(allyl)zinc in the presence of [18]crown-6?
What type of binding mode does the allyl ligand exhibit in the cationic part of compound 1?
What is the coordination geometry around the calcium atom in compound 1?
Based on the synthesis conditions, what is the role of [18]crown-6 in the formation of compound 1?
questions.answer: [18]crown-6 facilitates the isolation of the monocationic compound 1 by interacting with bis(allyl)calcium and bis(allyl)zinc.

questions.question: True or False: The allyl exchange rate in bis(allyl)zinc is much higher than that in compound 1.
What is the effect of the crown ether ligand on the allyl exchange rate in the [Ca-(C3H5)]+[Zn(C3H5)3]- system compared to compound 1?
questions.answer: The crown ether ligand causes a decrease of the allyl exchange rate in the [Ca-(C3H5)]+[Zn(C3H5)3]- system compared to compound 1.

questions.question: True or False: Compound 1 and its derivatives do not polymerize 1,3-butadiene under conditions used for bis(allyl)calcium.
What is the coordination geometry of the zinc atom in the anionic part of compound 1?
True or False: The C-C-C angle in the allyl fragment of the cationic part of compound 1 is significantly smaller than the corresponding angle in the anionic part.
What is the significance of the non-bent coordination geometry observed in compound 1?
questions.answer: It provides experimental evidence that the energy difference between linear and bent coordination geometries in organocalcium compounds is relatively small.

questions.question: True or False: The Ca-O distances in compound 1 are slightly longer than those found in calcium complexes with non-macrocyclic ether ligands.
What is the effect of temperature on the 1H NMR spectrum of compound 1 in THF solution?
questions.answer: At lower temperatures, two sets of well-separated resonances for the allyl moieties are observed, indicating that the ionic structure of 1 is maintained in solution.

questions.question: True or False: The proton-coupled 13C NMR spectrum of compound 1 at -80°C reveals an h3 or a m2-h1:h1 binding mode for the allyl ligand of the cation.
What are the values of DG‡, DH‡, and DS‡ for the allyl ligand exchange in compound 1?
True or False: The allyl exchange reaction in compound 1 runs through a transition state that is significantly more ordered compared to bis(allyl)zinc.
How does the reactivity pattern of compound 2 differ from the neutral parent compound bis(allyl)calcium?
questions.answer: Compound 2 shows different fundamental reactivity patterns of nucleophilicity and Lewis acidity compared to bis(allyl)calcium.

questions.question: True or False: The crown ether ligand in compound 1 is crucial to maintain the monoionic structure of the [Ca(C3H5)]+[Zn(C3H5)3]- system in the solid state.
What is the role of [18]crown-6 in the synthesis of compound 1 according to the experimental section?
questions.answer: [18]crown-6 is added to the reaction mixture of bis(allyl)calcium and bis(allyl)zinc in THF to facilitate the isolation of the monocationic compound 1.

questions.question: What is the significance of the observed C1-Ca1-C3’ angle in compound 1?
questions.answer: The C1-Ca1-C3’ angle of 178.80(11)° indicates no significant bending of the C-Ca-C unit, showcasing an unprecedented example of a non-metallocene organocalcium compound adopting a non-bent coordination geometry.

questions.question: Based on the synthesis conditions, what is the significance of the observed solubility properties of compound 1?
questions.answer: The solubility properties of compound 1, being insoluble in hydrocarbons, poorly soluble in diethyl ether, and very soluble in THF, indicate its unique interaction with solvents, which may affect its stability and reactivity.
